title: SMC3_PersistPositionSingleturn (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK SMC3_PersistPositionSingleturn
This function block serves to persist the axis position of an
absolute encoder that has a limited range.
Strictly speaking, this function block is not only for single-turn
encoders but also for multi-turn encoders where the range of the encoder
is a power of two and less than 2^32.
Both encoders with a range -2^k .. 2^k - 1 and a range 0 .. 2^(k+1)
are supported.
For a more general function block, see
SMC3_PersistPosition
, which allows
encoder ranges that are not a power of two (in bus increments).

rows:
Number of bits that are persistent (absolute encoded)
[1..32].

rows.Name: bPositionRestored
rows.Comment:
TRUE: The position has been restored during the last
start-up of the axis.

rows: TRUE: The position has been stored during the last call.
TRUE: Error has occurred within the function block.
